summary: This is an email from defense attorney Laura Menninger to prosecutors and other counsel regarding discovery requests in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It transmits an attached letter concerning discovery matters.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: She is the sender of the email, transmitting a discovery request letter on behalf of the defense in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pa Muca
persons.context: He is listed as a recipient (To:) of the email regarding discovery in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: He is listed as a recipient (Cc:) of the email. He is from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: She is listed as a recipient (Cc:) of the email regarding discovery in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Both are defense counsel copied on the same discovery communication in US v. Maxwell.
Defense attorney communicating with a prosecutor regarding discovery requests.
Defense attorney copying another attorney on a discovery communication.

events.title: Discovery Request Communication
events.description: Defense counsel Laura Menninger sends an email with an attached letter making discovery requests to the prosecution in US v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is an email from defense attorney Laura Menninger dated March 8, 2021, concerning the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (docket 20 Cr. 330).
The email transmits an attached letter (2021.03.08 LAM Letter to USAÂ° re discovery_(F).pdf) containing discovery requests from the defense to the prosecution.

The communication involves multiple legal parties: sender Laura Menninger (defense), primary recipient Jeff Pa Muca (prosecution), and cc'd recipients Christian R Everdell and Bobbi C Sternheim (defense).
The document is part of the ongoing discovery process in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case, indicating active pre-trial litigation in March 2021.
